sub_title: Senior Scientist at TNO Vector | Transition economics | Systems Innovation | Energy
summary: Transdisciplinary economic scientist leading quantitative and qualitative analysis and policy advice in a range of domains, including energy, sustainability and transport. Extensive experience with the design of research projects, programmes, and roadmaps; project and programme management; applied research and consulting at the intersection of economics, engineering, operations research and social science.

profile_positions.description:
Research, design of research projects and programmes, project management and leadership, with a primary focus on two themes: 
1) Systems Innovation: how to foster technical, policy, and social innovation to achieve transformative change in complex systems. 
2) Transition Economics: the economics of societal transitions, where achieving societal goals (e.g., Net Zero), rather than market efficiency in itself, is the desired outcome.
I work on these themes across domains, often but not exclusively in projects and programmes related to the energy and climate transition.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description: Research design, research, and project management with a focus on quantitative and qualitative analysis of energy and transport markets.
profile_positions.title: Scientist

profile_positions.description: PhD supervision and incidental teaching/research work.
profile_positions.title: Honorary Fellow

profile_positions.description: Responsible for operational management of all teaching activity in the Mechanical Engineering discipline, spanning 30+ courses across 6+ programmes taught by over 50 members of staff. Including contribution to management of teaching at School level.
profile_positions.title: Degree Programme Manager for Mechanical Engineering

profile_positions.description:
(equivalent to tenured assistant professor)
- Leading a research group working on techno-economic energy systems analysis with a particular focus on decision making under uncertainty. 
- Using mathematical methods, including optimisation and equilibrium modelling, statistics, and other tools to answer economic questions about engineering systems. 
- Teaching energy economics, macro/microeconomics, engineering mathematics, and statistics.
- Helping commercial clients with questions related to energy markets and energy system modelling as an independent consultant.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer in Energy Economics

profile_positions.description: Sabbatical fellowship to work on research questions related to energy system and market modelling under uncertainty and risk.
profile_positions.title: Alexander von Humboldt Experienced Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Part-time secondment to research data science applications in energy systems, looking particularly at the value of new energy data sources to market participants.
profile_positions.title: Turing Fellow

company.name: Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam and Tinbergen Institute

profile_positions.description:
- Research on the industrial organisation of network markets, using optimisation and equilibrium models to investigate transport network formation (how, for instance, rail networks evolve depending on market structures and the forward-lookingness of market participants), network operation (e.g.; how various forms of competition in networks influence profits and social benefits) and regulation.
- BA and MSc thesis supervision and delivery of tutorials on transport econometrics, environmental economics, and welfare economics.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: Conducting research on electricity transmission expansion planning and electricity market design, as part of the EPSRC Supergen FlexNet initiative. Included development of a stochastic transmission/generation investment and dispatch model for the UK to quantify the benefits of using stochastic transmission planning, as well as other models.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant, Electricity Policy Research Group

profile_positions.description: Teaching small groups of 3th/4th year undergraduate students in the Judge Business School's Management Studies Tripos.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor, International Economics
